posts.title: Looking for Leaders: Teen Council at 53rd Street Library
posts.text: If you're a New York City teen interested in developing programs at NYPL, and seeing how the library operates, Teen Council is looking for you.

posts.title: 1,000 Paper Cranes for 53rd Street Library
posts.text: The staff and patrons at the 53rd Street Library have embarked on an ambitious project to fold 1,000 paper cranes by International Day of Peace, which is September 21.

posts.title: Young Adult Beach Reads
posts.text: Coney Island, Rockaway Beach, Jersey Shore… summer is all about the beach! And no beach bag is complete without an immersive beach read.

posts.title: GLBT Book Month: Identity as a Detail, Not Feature
posts.text: Here are some stories where this is a detail about the character—not the main focus of the story.

posts.title: 'Surviving Santiago' Author Lyn Miller-Lachmann Visits George Bruce
posts.text: On November 11, the George Bruce branch was thrilled to have special guest Lyn Miller-Lachmann to discuss her book Surviving Santiago. This was the first TeenLIVE event to be co-hosted with NYPL's Innovation Labs, which is an after-school program for Middle School students.
